website_summaries.verdict: 8-ounce bag includes about 20,000 beads – a large amount for a little price.
pros: Color does not rub off these beads
The bag has several different sizes of beads in it
Kids will go crazy for these beads, and this package makes many beads
An easy, fun, and inexpensive way to get a big wow fun factor
cons: You may want a separate storage container for the dried beads
This only comes with a bag

customer_reviews.title: Slippery Tactile Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These breads are really fun for any kid, but if your kids are really into tactile things, they will love this. You only need to use a little bit of the beads in a mixing bowl, cover them with water and watch them expand. They are slippery, but not a slimy mess. My kids are 14 and 16 and loved them. Little kids would have a blast too. You can cover them up to store them and add more water if they seem to start shrinking. This pack of beads should last you many, many bowls full.
customer_reviews.author: crazeemarchese

customer_reviews.title: SO fun for kids!
customer_reviews.text: These are SO much fun!!! I got them for our 5 year old to have another sensory style toy - we put them in cups, in the water table, in cake pans, wherever. It's fun to watch them grow (slowly, about 8 hours but change is immediate once they are in the water) and they are super fun to play with. Something about the texture - they aren't slimy which is surprising! There are tons of them! They are teeny tiny but get marble sized in water. Don't be fooled by the small package :)
customer_reviews.author: MusicianMama

customer_reviews.title: Fun and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these beads to use a sensory play with my toddler. I didn't follow the directions, and let her play with them before they were soaked completely, which I'm sure is why more fell apart than stayed together. I'm planning to use them mostly in our water table outside, but certainly would use them indoors again on one of those days where I'm out of things to keep her busy. I've also stuck a bunch in my potted basil plant, which has helped it to survive while we go out of town for a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: Becki Work

customer_reviews.title: Balls get to be the size of marbles!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for my 2 and 3 year old sons. I have to say I was initially surprised by how small the bag was when I opened my amazon box. But once I started adding water, I realized how much was really in that little bag. My boys absolutely loved playing with them - especially with the little scooper toys I bought with them. I started with 1/4 cup scoop of balls and after adding 2 cups of water about 4x we finally reached the size of marbles! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Natalya K.

customer_reviews.title: Used as a stocking stuffer and both my 5 year old and two year old love them. Can’t say I fully get the appeal
customer_reviews.text: So my 5 year old was begging for orbeez. After doing some research and reading reviews, decided to go with sooper beads. Exact same product, just half the price. Used as a stocking stuffer and both my 5 year old and two year old love them. Can’t say I fully get the appeal, but im an adult, so I just accept the fact that I’ll never know. Delivery was quick and product does as promised. Loads of fun and smile from the kids so totally worth it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: samantha500

customer_reviews.title: A great value for a fun product!
customer_reviews.text: This will last me forever! A tablespoon of beads makes half a shoe box of squishy fun! I use it with preschoolers (who don't put things in their mouths) for speech/language therapy. It is a wonderful sensory activity. I would order from this seller again. It arrived on time, was well packaged, and has good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: pengu1n

customer_reviews.title: These made my kids VERY happy! Tiny hard colored "seeds" that grow and feel ...
customer_reviews.text: These made my kids VERY happy! Tiny hard colored "seeds" that grow and feel squishy! What could make them happier? They went a little crazy with experimentation, so be warned (They filled a bowl in the sink, then transferred the contents into a plastic tub to see if they would grow more...Then into a giant plastic storage bin! And there they sit, until warmer weather. They are planning to have a fight in the backyard, throwing these at each other. Good idea? Who knows!)
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Meyers

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on water beads before I decided on these. I purchased for my granddaughter's 3rd birthday. They are all that I expected and we all couldn't resist playing with them. We used a plastic pan and placed 2 tablespoons in 3 quarts of water to soak overnight. Watching them grow was part of the fun. This will be a fun activity to play with from time to time and a great way to sort and count by color.
customer_reviews.author: R Lea

customer_reviews.title: Meh Colors - Maybe I Got a Bad Batch
customer_reviews.text: Though these beads work the way they’re supposed to and my kids love them, I am disappointed in the colors. There is a large percentage of white and clear beads, and the beads with colors seem very pale. This doesn’t seem to be the case with the other pictures I’ve seen, so maybe I just received a bad batch. I agree with others that have mentioned the beads are easy to break, but I find this only happens once they’re pierced (e.g. medium to long finger nails), which seems to be common for water beads. Overall, I’d say they’re worth the price, but I wish they had more color.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap and you get a bag that will last ...
customer_reviews.text: Super cheap and you get a bag that will last a long time. Be sparing with how many you use because what looks like a small amount can turn into a huge clean up pretty quickly! I put them in my bathtub for my kids when it was raining and let them take a bath with them. When we were finished I just used a colander to scoop them up. It took about ten minutes, but we got them all out without clogging the drain!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wester

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I wanted to use them for a sensory bin with my toddler. I placed a few teaspoons in water and let them expand overnight. When we woke up they had expanded from oh, idk, the size of a lentil to the size of a small marble. They are squishable and will break if squeezed hard (or whacked with a spoon, as my toddler discovered), but durability is good overall. They maintain moisture in a sealed container. My son plays with these all the time and they've held up well to a lot of play. The package size should last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: C Knox

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: This picture is just a teaspoon of beads that sat in water for a little less than an hour ( a few are on the floor). They swell fast and are durable (only because I didn't let them swell up to its full potential). These are definitely the best sensory toy for toddlers I have ever given my son. He played with play doh, kenetic sand, flour, bubbles, shaving cream, bubbles- but this takes the cake. I think because you can combine these water beads with all the stuff I listed and it's okay. I also love that it's easy to clean up, cheap and long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Rivera family

customer_reviews.title: I love these! They are my student's favorite
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They are my student's favorite! I always start the year with these in my sensory tub. One package fills a tub that is 2 ft wide by 3 ft long by 1 ft deep. Actually my older student volunteers, parents, and other teachers love them too. Many of my students have never played with them before. At the end of a few months I bag them up and donate them to families in my class. I have various pieces of pvc pipe and funnels for the kids to manipulate them and build systems. I would highly recommend these for your sensory tubs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for craft with water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I used these in a craft for my son's pirate themed 6th birthday party. They worked perfectly and the kids loved watching them swell up. Great value for your money. We did not use very many for the craft and we were able to fill up a large size kiddie pool while what we had left which also was a huge hit with the kids. Even the older kids liked to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very very cool! I bought these to make stress balls and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very very cool! I bought these to make stress balls and was very pleasantly surprised with how great it worked out. If you squeeze too hard or use your nail on them the balls will break apart and make a mess, but if you squeeze more generally like you wood on a stress ball then they seem to stay together, at least they have in the balls I made a few weeks ago. I can imagine tho that young kids would be tempted to eat these because they are brightly colored and look like they could be candy.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are a blast! I've yet to just let kids play with them because I don't trust my littlest ones to taste test these things, but I did make some rad "I Spy" bottles for our roadtrip with them. I used blue and a few green with seashells, sand, and sea animals in one. The other I used all the colors with random animals and purple sand. Maybe you can't tell from the photo, but these are super fun and entertaining. I took photos of the things to find in each one, so they have to keep rotating and flipping until they find the animals.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny P

customer_reviews.title: Sooper for the Senses!
customer_reviews.text: Sooper beads are SUPER! My son loves them..! I enjoy them almost as much as he does I found myself playing with them by myself just a few minutes ago to relax, lol... They form beautiful colored orbs and are a fun jelly-like texture to touch. I felt disappointed when they arrived because the bag was so small, but I've already made several batches and it's barely made a dent in the quantity. Great value. Very few of the beads are broken when hydrated - most of them are perfect until my son squishes them. Thanks for a great product! <3
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these through a blog that was giving instructions for sensory bottles. The tiny little beads hydrated pretty quickly (didnt take the 4 hours some say). And, as an experiment, we let them dry out and shrink up. The kids guessed they would be restored by adding water again, and they were right. Now they're trying to come up with more uses for them!
customer_reviews.author: G. Faria

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity that lasts months!
customer_reviews.text: Fun activity for kids! My kids loved getting these ready and watching them "grow". We have gotten hours of play out of them! They are fun to sort and soothing to stick your hands in! Once hydrated we played with them for 3 months before I finally threw them away. Every week rinse them with fresh water in a colander to keep them fresh. We initially used 2 tablespoons to hydrate. So, this big bag will last a while!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Elenore

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, squishy and colorful!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my daughters and to take some to school for my Emotionally Disturbed students. Wow - this makes a ton of these things! These are so nice and relaxing to play with and stress relieving! My girls love sticking their hands and feet in a container full of them. My students enjoy running their fingers through them - I'm just hoping that none decide to throw these, because they roll far and bounce. The colors of the beads are awesome - so pretty! Great buy! I will definitely order more in the future. Just be careful - you don't need to use a lot of beads to make a good amount. It makes more than you think!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Sherman

customer_reviews.title: nice quality and amount of product for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my niece for Christmas after she heard me explaining how neat of a product they were. The beads come in a double sealed ziplock bag, with nearly 20,000 inside. All you need is a couple tablespoons to fill a bowl nicely for play when they have finished expanding. These are great for sensory play for kids, and for educational purposes as well. The kids love to sort them by color, use spoons and other utensils to mix them, and adjust the level of water in the bowl to see the beads shrink and grow with size. We love water beads and this set is a nice price for the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Do not use in sensory bins
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids sensory table. I usually buy the water beads for flowers at a chain craft store but since these were (much much) less expensive & they had good reviews I bought these. I have to say I am disappointed in them. They are not good for sensory tables at all. They have been in our sensory bin for less than 2 weeks & have disintegrated . (By comparison they other ones bought at a craft store have been in the sensory bin completely intact for 2 years). Maybe they work great for other purposes but they don’t work for sensory bins.
customer_reviews.author: LKR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Birthday Party Attraction
customer_reviews.text: 2 bags of these beads in a kiddie pool was the hit of my seven year old son's birthday party. I had slip n' slides, obstacle races, a home made sprinkler ... but all the kids wanted to hang out in the water bead pool. It was a tactile hit - they loved the feeling of the beads (though they also squished quite a few). Everything was as advertised and made for an enjoyable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great size for toddler hands, not great for toddler man handling
customer_reviews.text: These water beads do get large, which is why I wanted them. They are bright and fun in color They texture is the same as other smaller water beads The durability is weaker than smaller water beads. Great size for toddler hands, not so great for squeezing. I would use them for older kids, but my 2 year old cried once she broke one, then kept trying to squeeze the next one, and before long a melt down and a mess was all I was left with
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and Great beads
customer_reviews.text: These cute little water beads came in the small package shown and the colors shown and when added to water you get marble sized beads.they do get squishy and will breakup after being in water for a long time,some will but not all.it doesn't take many to make a lot so these beads can last a while.my grandkids and I loved them.they played with them in the tub,outside,many times and I still have some beads that I haven't even used yet because like I said it doesn't take much to have fun with these water beads.and I will certaintly be buying more in the future
customer_reviews.author: lala

customer_reviews.title: Buy the KINFAV instead
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few different brands and these were by far the worse. The beads split just after a couple hours in the water. I've bought others that lasted days. These were just the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yay! Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Too fun! Tried with hot water and cold water. Best with cold. Also don't leave them in the water much past 4 hours. I know you're probably tempted to try and get them as big as possible, but then they begin to break and fall apart easily. They ended up all over my house, but still really fun and relaxing. I suggest like other people have said, don't cover them up, they will smell.
customer_reviews.author: The Paulson’s

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for kids!
customer_reviews.text: These are really fun for kids. If I had a couple drinks I'd sit and play with them too! Who am I kidding, I'd do that without the drinks. Lol. Just a tablespoon of these entertains the kids for hours. Has to sit for about 8 hours to absorb the water so it's best to start them at night time so the kids don't start playing with them before they're ready. Throw in some measuring cups, put them into big bowls and pans and let them go to town!
customer_reviews.author: DragonLady

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the fun, but buy more than you think you need!
customer_reviews.text: We have played with these many times and I thought it might be fun to fill a kiddie pool with them for my child's party. We drastically underestimated the quantity needed - two of these did not even cover the bottom of the pool. Also, it was quite a mess to clean up as there was no easy way to empty them out of the pool without losing them all over the patio and lawn. But, the kids loved it, so I guess that's what matters!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: and their fun.
customer_reviews.text: i give a little of these to each of my friends with toddlers. they all text me and say "im working out in peace for an hour now! thank you!" or "my kids are sharing and getting along when they play with these" they should call these beads magic peace makers. buy them. even if the clean up is tough it is worth your peace....and their fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amycakes712

customer_reviews.title: A little make a lot
customer_reviews.text: 1/4 cup of these plus 1 gallon of purified water came out to like 2 gallons of beads (maybe more). Wish I had measured the output it so I can to be exact. Lets just say it was a lot more than I expected. I ran a test with tap water and purified water. Definitely use distilled or purified water if you can especially if you are using it in clear vases to decorate a party which is what I used it for.
customer_reviews.author: Addie

customer_reviews.title: ... was having for my daughter and I fell in love with them
customer_reviews.text: I bought two bags of these for a spa party I was having for my daughter and I fell in love with them. We had so much fun! They were a good size after being in the water for four hours. I allowed them to sit for eight hours and they eventually filled a entire plastic tote I had them in.
customer_reviews.author: Kae

customer_reviews.title: This is a HUGE quantity
customer_reviews.text: I got this to refill a premade sensory bin kit my kids had. 1 tablespoon did the trick - and this package contains many many tablespoons. It can probably fill a tub. Great product, worked as per instructions, my kids love it! Just don't let your toddler use it while eating breakfast, it may get dumped into the cereal with milk ;)
customer_reviews.author: Menucha CC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy for 6 bucks
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome for a toddler, of course u need to watch so they dont eat them. The picture is just some of the 20k. They start growing immediately when you soak them in water. I would add water and once I see there's no water left I would add more. My daughter loves to hid her little toys in a bowl full of these. I also like to put them in tub so she can play and it won't be making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Monika Vega

customer_reviews.title: Tons of water beads for cheap!
customer_reviews.text: These water beads are great! The pack looks small, but there are actually tons in there. These were our first experience with water beads of any kind, and my kids are hooked! Definitely wouldn't recommend for any kids that still put things in their mouths, but these were the perfect way to kill several hours with my preschooler and first grader (and even my fourth grader loved them).
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: its nice to be able to give them something to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: HOURS of entertainment for both my kids, ages 4 and 2. My daughter has some sensory issues and we ordered these as part of her occupational therapy treatment. I was worried she wouldn't go near them but she plays with them non stop. my son loves to see them bounce and likes to fill up bottles with them and dump them out. its nice to be able to give them something to keep them busy while I cook or tend to other things. love the various colors of this pack, helps us teach our daughter her colors too. will be ordering these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle and Richard Rupanovic

customer_reviews.title: Fun... mostly
customer_reviews.text: I picked the clear ones out to do a fun experiment with my kids by placing a toy dinosaur in a clear glass with them and then filling it with water. Then they did a fun experiment with me where they dropped a bucket of these on the floor to see how long it took to pick millions of the damn things up
customer_reviews.author: Ash Bee

customer_reviews.title: Creepy cool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool sensory product! You can watch them swell in front of your eyes and the kids love the feeling as well as squishing them. I love the recycle aspect of pouring them into your garden when the kids are done so they can water the plants the over time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was so much!!
customer_reviews.text: These are fricking Awesome! That being said little warning might be in order for mom's who are clueless about these... something along the lines of this bag will fill half a garden tub :D wasn't expecting them to get quite so big or how much space they would fill but it's cool.. the girls thought it was amazing
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany oakland felthoff

customer_reviews.title: Water Beads a big hit with my Great grandson
customer_reviews.text: I put the beads in water in the evening. they were in a shallow pan. In the morning when my great grandson came to spend the day, they were a wonderful surprise for him. He loved playing with them. I had stirred in some small sea shells for him to find and it was so much fun. I didn't see before I ordered them that they were for four years or older, so I was a little concerned to let him play with them. He is only two years old. Everything was fine until he decided they looked good enough to eat. I put them away and will try them again when he is a little older.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Parker

customer_reviews.title: great long lasting fun!
customer_reviews.text: we lovr these! I have 2 children (5 and 2 years old) they both have a blast with the water beads. We even bought a second pack for my son's kindergarten class, they just received them but are thrilled 😁 the beads colora fade a bit as they grow, but we still decided to separate them by color, smash a bash, experiment with them in the bath tub, have our toy animals join in the fun!!
customer_reviews.author: miriam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sensory play
customer_reviews.text: Love!!! These are so great for sensory play with your child. I will buy them over and over. Only thing make sure you let them start soaking before you tell your toddler as they take 8 hours to fully soak and you know that a toddler can't wait for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ulmer

customer_reviews.title: Great raining day fun!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these! Yes, there are a few that are warped but for the price I don't mind. The kids love to play in them- hands, feet, treasure hunts, etc! They begged me to put them all in the bathtub! I have one kiddo that is on the autism spectrum and it's the perfect sensory activity for him and my typical kid. Learning is fun when you can hunt for things like sight words in a big tub of beads!! Would highly recommend these :)
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Makes a ton! Great for sensory fidgets.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for sensory play. I am a special education teacher and wanted to make fidgets for my students. I put some in clear balloons for the kids to manipulate with their hands and still be able to see the rainbow colors. Using about 1/3 of the bag made 6 gallons, so do not underestimate how much these expand. Apparently they are reuseable so I have some sitting out so I can see how long they take to shrink. It has been about 5 days and they have not shrunk yet. Will buy again, especially at this good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Just like orbies only you get way more for your money and you soak them yourself so u dont have to do the bag all at once. When the first batch has been played with for a few months throw them out and make more.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee K.

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Work exactly as advertised. We've had 100% of the water beads grow as they should so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun for all my kids ages one to thirteen. And they make for fun pictures too. They are reusable and durable enough especially bc it comes with SO MANY. But they will break apart once they have soaked up water for awhile, definitely ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Tigertails

customer_reviews.title: Large amount of beads, great fun and great color!
customer_reviews.text: These water beads are awesome! I purchased the 8 oz package which doesn't initially seem like a lot of beads when it first arrives. However, you don't need very many of these in a bowl or vase for them to take up a good amount of room. They grow a lot bigger than the size they arrive as. Also, the colors of these beads are great. The colors are very pretty in the bag and also in a vase. I have no issues with this purchase at all!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Fun sensory toy, great value
customer_reviews.text: Great fun and a TON of beads! I wanted to get an idea of how many beads are needed to fill a plastic wading pool for a fun activity at a kids party. Picture shows 1/2 tablespoon dry beads plus 3 cups water soaked overnight (did half the "recipe" included on package). I like that there are several sizes, clear and solid colors. My 3year old daughter and 14month old son both loved scooping and dumping from various containers. Hawk like supervision needed for any kid who might put these in their mouth! I had fun with these too.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: 24 hours from start the soda bottle was pretty full. I’m giving it three stars because the ...
customer_reviews.text: They grow FAST. I used 1 TSP beads to 16oz of water. Put them in a 16.9oz soda bottle to mature. Grew them for 3-4 hours. Then left them overnight. By 3pm the next day, 24 hours from start the soda bottle was pretty full. I’m giving it three stars because the colors aren’t very vivid. The black and white ones look nasty to me. Not soothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Yum’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: We had a large community day with my ministry and had a bin of these out for the kids to play with. Couldn't imagine spending that much on the name brand for only a day's play. These are great and fun. kids love them.
customer_reviews.author: fraggle

customer_reviews.title: Fun Play
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my kids (4 & 5) to play with in a sensory bin filled with plastic insects and such. They loved them and the colors are vibrant and fun! My only complaint is they take FOREVER to shrink down for storage. I had a small group sitting on a towel for days and they hardly shrunk at all. I got annoyed with the process so I put them into 4/gallon size zip locks & hoping they don't get moldie. There fun and perfect for preschool play but a pain for at home play (I say this because they are inconvenient for storage and clean up thats why I give 4/5 stars).
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Bought multiple packs of these water beads for a sensory box for my 2-year old grandson. I did not let them "grow" to their full size because I didn't want them to be easy to pop, and they are perfect. I only reconstituted 1/2 of one package and it was plenty for a large sensory box. Absolutely mesmerizing for him AND me! I added some scoops and cups to the box and his parents tell me he asks daily to play with them! Grandma-Approved Activity!
customer_reviews.author: momtime

customer_reviews.title: unexpectedly wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great product for kids play. Sorting these by color in a muffin tin could fill hours of a young (or not so young) child's day. We have only used a small portion of the amount that came in this bag, and it filled more than a gallon container when expanded. My kids (ages 6, 9, 10, & 12) did an experiment and it turns out they will dry out and return to their original size, in case you ever felt like watching paint dry ;)
customer_reviews.author: K. Mitzel

customer_reviews.title: Fun.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these soopers beads and a pkg of marvel beads both the same oz size for sensory play. This is the whole pkg in a 58 qt storage bin after being left overnight. These beads produced more volume and just slightly bigger bead. Se broke during play but not enough to cause a problem
customer_reviews.author: momok

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensory
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! We use them in sensory bottles in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome to play with. We give them to the kids to throw at each other, or blow out of their dart guns. They degrade into the soil so there's no mess to clean up when you're scattering thousands of them everywhere. When our 3 year old told us that the dog was eating them, we started taking bets. I unfortunately lost the bet as the beads do not exit uncompromised.
customer_reviews.author: Sirilla Crowe

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: These are great if your working with kids who have autism, or other diagnosis with sensory processing disorder. The sizes come out differently and it really stimulates their hands. Also, they feel good for me, sometimes just to put my hands in, and other therapists, parents, or providers who bring their kiddos to our clinic. Try putting some beads in an empty water bottle, fill back up with water, and when they are ready, partially blow up a balloon, wrap it over the nozzle, and pour it in. It makes a great sensory toy for kids. Make sure to get rid of excess water first, and then tie the balloon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian James

customer_reviews.title: Sensory fun
customer_reviews.text: These are so cool and so fun!! I really enjoy them but my kids may be a little young for them (1 and 3). They ended up everywhere and they squish and break when forced. I would say these would be great for 4 years plus. This bag has plenty in it for many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Chase

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE them!! Even my mom loves them!!! They’re very Colorful They Grow Quick They’re Fun to play with and my mom uses them with her plants and flowers Who knew lol Fun for the whole family 😂 Is definitely tell others to purchase these
customer_reviews.author: Stacey😷

customer_reviews.title: Cool!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Perfect for a tub full! Lasted a long time...enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Q

customer_reviews.title: Work Great, great packaging too!
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to these - they either work or they don't. These work great and fully enlarged with water after only about 2 hours or so. The packaging is great, as we don't make all the beads at the same time, the pouch they come in is nice and durable and has a great zip seal - which is really handy. Bought from others before and they were a mess all the time because of cheap bag, or putting them into something else. Nice product - will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love Them But Be Careful!
customer_reviews.text: I personally don't see what the hype is about but I will say the kids love them. They have so much fun with these water beads. Some advice for first time buyers...a little goes a long way! They get quite big after you put them in water for awhile so definitely don't use the whole bag at once. Also if you have young kids (I'd say under 4) keep these away from them because they are definitely a choking hazard!
customer_reviews.author: M Ives

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: I put these in a little tub of water and let my toddler fish them out. It was a great activity. They grow pretty quickly. Adult Supervision is a must since they are a choking hazard
customer_reviews.author: Bess urra

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun.
customer_reviews.text: My girls love them and the dog also had a great time chasing after the ones that got away. I only hate the face that my smiley face Hurts now from watching them enjoy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Muslim

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all..
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed! We followed the directions completely and they are NOT durable. More than half of them crumbled upon the slightest touch! I was so hoping they would last for atleast an hour..
customer_reviews.author: GirlBoss

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these. They start expanding pretty quickly getting to full size (medium marble-size) in about a day. The kids love holding them, moving them between cups, stomping on them in a bucket, and jumping with them on a trampoline. :) They can be messy - so advised to go outside with these.. but we enjoyed them so much we bought a second pack.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: these are so fun! lots of fun projects and experiments with them
customer_reviews.text: these are so fun! lots of fun projects and experiments with them. you only use 1tbs for about a 1/2 of a gallon ziplock full of beads. these will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: These are so much fun! Although they take 8 hours to completely absorb ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun! Although they take 8 hours to completely absorb the water, my toddler had a fun time checking on them every now and then and seeing how they were growing. I would say they are durable and they do not "pop" however when we put them in the bathtub a lot of them weakened and broke I'm guessing because of too much water. Other than that we have no complaints! Great for a rainy day.
customer_reviews.author: Patti M.

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and good price
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered these they were not included in the package and didn't get delivered. I tried again and we used them today for sensory fun for my 2 year old. He loved them and loved scooping them. They reached full size in 3 hours vs the recommended 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: JESSIE

customer_reviews.title: Really nice inexpencive water beads
customer_reviews.text: These little fellows, are super cool. I say fellows because they where a gift for my daughter and she gives the ones she likes most names. Lol. There are so many its crazy how they grow. Now some are not round, tear drop shape and oval, but it does not bother me. Beedos are all uniform in shape. Be careful on how many you do at a time they grow like crazy, i think i did a table spoon or so and filled up 2 tupper ware to the max and then some. I think this whole bag will fill up my tub.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my daughter's birthday. We used the entire package for a water table. They were a hit with the kids. I was worried because I got them the day of the event and it said that it could take 8 hours, it only took a couple. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love these
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews on these water beads I opted for this brand because the reviews were really good. However I did exactly what was called for. Placed in large pool with cool water (let even sit overnight) and only about 1/8 of the beads grew in size. Most of them just sat and never grew in size and then just got slimy. My son was so excited to play with them, what a disappointment. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Color is weak.
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Some of the beads were misshapen. When we followed the package instructions, they crumbled too easily. I soak them maybe six hours now. Also, the colors are not as bright as pictured. They're mostly clear with a slight tint, except the white and black, which are pretty strong. We do have fun with them, though, and they'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described, great value for money, durability is good but they will pop with pressure (which actually made for great experience). Overall great product to use for preschoolers!!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if its normal or not but they got big and are so delicate. Had them sitting and a water table and after a couple of days they just kind of turned into mush. Kids still like them.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and reusable
customer_reviews.text: These are super fun and I can't imagine ever needing to buy them again unless I do some huge project... there are so many! My 2 year old loves to play with them (VERY closely supervised, of course). Just be sure you realize they take about 8 hrs to swell up in water... I started out with them thinking they'd expand instantly, til I read the directions... oops!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Momma

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun! I bought them for my 2.5 year old daughter and fill her water table up with them. These kept her (and me) occupied for hours. A little bit goes a long way though, just a tablespoon of the dry beads soaked and filled up enough to fill her water table.
customer_reviews.author: LoganA

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, fun, multiple uses for creativity
customer_reviews.text: Cheap fun and will entertain kids. I hide little plastic fish or gems for sensory exploration. Only need a little bit to make a large bowl full. I use these in therapy and my kids enjoy them to just relax.
customer_reviews.author: robyn76

customer_reviews.title: good sensory material
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for 4 y.o. granddaughter, who enjoys these at her nursery school. She was excited when I presented them to her, and wanted to use right away. They seem to be a good sensory material. My understanding is that these are re-usable, that is, they expand when soaked in water, and return to normal size when dry.
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: So cool! We soaked the whole bag at once in a 5 gallon bucket for about 3 hours. Bouncy slippery super awesome. 4 year old was extatic. But they expanded much we had to dump them in the bath tub to drain the excess water and played with them there, which is fun, but certainly we did t need to make the whole package at once.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hornig

customer_reviews.title: great for kids of age
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price.A teaspoon will do the trick or the whole bag. The longer you let them soak, i say, some will grow a bit bigger.My kids love watching them grow. No this product is not intended that stick everything in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: purplelondon

customer_reviews.title: Fun and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep my plants watered during an extended trip out of town. I soaked these up and mixed them into my soil. My plants were still alive after 3 weeks! The bag may seem small, buy be prepared, dony underestimate just how many water beads you'll get out of this! One spoonful of beads can expand to fill a 16oz glass to the brim.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Wu

customer_reviews.title: These beads are ok. When my daughter poured them ...
customer_reviews.text: These beads are ok. When my daughter poured them in the bathtub for the longest time ever nothing happened, until a few of them started to get bigger, but not all of them got that way. Let me add this, the water by this was cold. It took overnight for these beads to completely get bigger. The one bag, is not enough for a bathtub. Maybe three four bags so the kids have "fun" otherwise there is no use.
customer_reviews.author: Maria💫

customer_reviews.title: these are awesome! I recommend measuring and we did 4 tbl ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW! these are awesome! I recommend measuring and we did 4 tbl in our water table, so fun, some did break apart right away but it really doesn't matter there are soooooooooooo many. We ordered them a 2nd time already even though the first bag has many more uses because I am sure we will use them again, they were such a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My family loves them, kids especially the kids. They are really small, but grow to a normal marble size. The bag should last awhile, there are plenty inside the package. These beads are not just for playing, you can do some really nice decorative ideas as well. I will say this, don't leave covered or they will get moldy.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Williams

customer_reviews.title: Last a long time!! Good value!
customer_reviews.text: I can not tell you how many packs of these I have probably sold for this company. I shared the direct link with almost all of my friends and they went crazy over them! I had friends sending me pictures of their bathtubs filled with these water beads! Kids LOVE them & they’re so decently priced! You will not regret purchasing these; they last forever!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: amazing !!!!
customer_reviews.text: love this !!! so many beads... tons !!! days of fun I made a batch for my 3 year old (had to soak overnight) but totally worth it... she ahs been paying with them for 2 days straight great buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun project for a rainy afternoon
customer_reviews.text: 2 TB of dry beads made almost a gallon of waterbeads when they had soaked up all the water. Such a fun project for a rainy afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Great but.........
customer_reviews.text: Well..... I used these for a birthday party on September 9th 2019 and it’s February 12th 2020 and they are still in my back yard if you have it in a kiddie pool great but if they touch the ground and you don’t pick them up they will stay there and then become a blob on the ground with color
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great stocking stuffer
customer_reviews.text: These work great! My kids and I love to make a batch and play with them for several days. One bag will last a long time unless you're planning on filling up a bathtub all at once! It is especially fun to pick out all the clear ones and put them in a glass of water. They disappear until you stick your hand in! So fun!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun product
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun! I read the reviews that said they were hard to "pop" but I don't think they were - we accidentally popped a few trying to push them into a bottle to use as table number holders for my daughter's wedding. We put them in water and when they got big we picked out the colors we wanted and the bottles look great. Everyone who has seen them at my house has loved them and wanted to buy some.
customer_reviews.author: B. Romer

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They get to be substantially larger than name brand orbeez... They grow from the size of a grain of rice to the size of a grape. 100 dry orbees makes about 1 3/4 cup fully grown. I purchased 2 packages & they'd be more than enough for a normal sized tub, but for my big tub I'm going to do 4 packages next time. The kids had so much fun with them, I'll definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Towerchick

customer_reviews.title: There are also a lot of STEM activities you can do with these
customer_reviews.text: Fun water beads that work very well. You can even dry them out and then hydrate them again! I bought these for my autistic son's sensory play, but his sisters like to play with them too. There are also a lot of STEM activities you can do with these, just look them up on Pintrest!
customer_reviews.author: S. Sample

customer_reviews.title: SO MANY BEADS
customer_reviews.text: There are so many of these beads in one small package. They are beautifully colored and there’s a good variety of color. The reason why I took away one star was because after they are fully grown and have absorbed the water, they start to get fragile and break if your fingernail catches on them or if you’re too rough on them. But it’s not that bad so they’re still worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rhianna Deschner

customer_reviews.title: Fun experiment
customer_reviews.text: This is fun for kids, although it can be a mess. The beads break pretty easily so as long as you aren’t too concerned with that. They are great!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: These are a lot of fun!! They grow / expand in water
customer_reviews.text: These are a lot of fun!! They grow / expand in water, then can be used for different activities/ crafts after. My sons really enjoy them. Be sure to use just a small amount at a time, as the beads need room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Galiah Morgenstern

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIESE BEADS
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIESE BEADS, I USE THEM IN MY PLANTERS FOR WATER RETENSION AND THIS PRODUCT IS JUST WHAT IS NEEDED FOR SMALL TO LARGE PLANTERS
customer_reviews.author: ALBEEDO

customer_reviews.title: You get quite a few of these water beads at a good price. Great for sensory bins for kids.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my daughter to have in her sensory bin in her preschool classroom. If you've not use these before as a sensory material, you definitely should. Small children love to squish and hold these balls after you have rehydrated them. Try hiding small objects in the bin full of these for kids to find. Kids love them! You get quite a few of these water beads at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Pocketmouse

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! But wow! there are A LOT of them. Wish the package had come with just a few more instructions. I used the entire bag and had to keep moving them into bigger containers as they grew. To give a perspective of just how many there are...I eventually put them in my son's hard plastic swimming pool and they covered the bottom. It was awesome and he had a great time with them. It took about 7 days but they did eventually dry out and go right back to their original tiny size.
customer_reviews.author: ~M

product_meta.title: Sooper Beads Water Beads Rainbow Mix, 8 oz (20,000 beads) for Soothing Spa Refill, Sensory Toys and Décor
product_meta.description:
What to do with water beads? 

Water Beads for Sensory Water table: Sensory play is what water beads are best at. Kids of all ages love the feel and look of them. They are so enticing colorful, smooth, squishy, cool... Really, there's not much more you need to do with water beads than have a bowl full of them to plunge your hands into and hold and squish them. Water gel beads seem like magic to kids because the beads start out so tiny and grow within a few hours. Just watching the beads change is a fun activity for younger kids.

Learning activities for kids: With our new enhanced color sensory water beads, we aim to engage kids with colors, textures, and imagination. The interactive colors encourage matching, sorting, and mixing which help improve a child's fine motor skills

Use it to fill your kiddie pool, Fill your bathtub for fun bath time, Use it as a candle holder or vase filler, Use with your water beads gun, fill a small balloon to make a stress ball. Best of all use your imagination and creativity for hours of fun.

Decorating with water beads: Use them in vases, bowls, and jars, DIY art projects for eye appeal. They are great for centerpieces for weddings and other events. The water gel pearls really add a wow factor that can turn ordinary vases and bowls into something beautiful.

Water beads for plants to retain water and reduce the amount of watering plants need. They release the water gradually so the plant isn't flooded with water. The water beads can also act as a replacement of soil for Bamboo plants 

Therapy toy, occupational therapy toys or sensory processing toys: These can be used as autism sensory toys for special needs. Play therapy toys have been shown to be effective as sensory processing disorder toys. 

Relaxation: Water beads are also used for many foot massage soothing spa, and it can be used to refill many other toy products which use water beads.
feature_bullets: Huge 8 oz. value pack of high quality crystal water beads - water gel beads [rainbow mix]
A great learning sensory toy for preschool kids to encourage processing skills
Thousand of uses: Decoration, wedding centerpieces, baby showers, water table toys, plant decoration
Ideal for growing bamboo plant, candle, silk & cut flower arrangements, centerpieces and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,609 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
